comments.author: Luke
comments.body: 'tis a poster you guys need in your lobby!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: If only I knew where I could get a copy of this poster... I'd buy it in the blink of a heartbeat!

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: I hope you manage to find one. Perhaps you should employ your readership to scour the globe? It's pretty obscure though. Where did you find the picture?

comments.author: steph v.
comments.body: Where did you find the picture?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Do a Google image search for Moxie... it's on the first page.

comments.author: Allison
comments.body:
I guess you found this website then, too:
http://www.mainegoodies.com/food/Moxie/index.htm

You can buy Moxie Soda (from Maine) and have UPS deliver it.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: We plan on having a few bottles of Moxie on hand, in case someone wants to try it. I've heard from several reliable sources that it's AWFUL!

comments.author: Allison
comments.body:
For more information on Moxie, see also:
http://encyclopedia.thefreedictionary.com/Moxie

I'll see if I can't round up some of the soda at my neighborhood store.

comments.author: Evan Erwin
comments.body: Oh man, that is raw sexy on a poster. You MUST get one for the theater!

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: Since it's just antique 'ephemera,' as they say, I don't know if there's any copywright associated with it.  Do you have any qualms about just reproducing it yourself off of that image?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: I have no qualms about reporducing it, but the low resolution would not translate well to a nice lobby poster.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: This is where dim lighting comes in.
